doc.line: This interface offers a set of common methods for Content Access Modules (CAM). The CAM provide and update POI and categories information from remote sources to the POIService modules
RegisterContentAccessModule = Register to the POI provider module.
When the CAM registers, it provides a name and then get a unique id. This id must be used everytime the CAM communicates with the POI service component.
After the registration is done, the CAM can start to update POI categories and POI attributes as well as registers POI categories to search for.
moduleName = The name of the CAM.
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
The registration failed (for instance the name is not unique).
UnRegisterContentAccessModule = Remove CAM from POI provider module.
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
This error is generated if an application tries to send data to the POI service component but the CAM id is not registered.
RegisterPoiCategories = Register to the POI provider module the categories you can search for POI.
The categories could be predifined one or customized ones. In order to register a customized category, you might need to create it before and add it to the POI service component.
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
poiCategories = array[unique_id]
List of POI categories to register.
unique_id = Unique category id
This error is generated if an application tries to send data to the POI service component but the CAM id is not registered.
The category was already registered.
AddCategories = Add new categories to the POI service component.
The CAM provides for each categories the name, the parent categories, the top level attribute, the list of attributes, the icons, ... .
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
poiCategories = array[details, attributes, sortOptions]
List of details for all the POI categories.
details = struct(list of parents_id, icons, name, short_desc, media)]
parents_id = list of parent categories unique id
icons = visual icons set
name = name
short_desc = short category description (optional)
media = medial associated (html web site, audio, video, ...) (optional)
attributes = array[struct(name, type, array[struct(operator_id, operator_name)])
name = attribute unique name
type = enum(INVALID,STRING,INTEGER,COORDINATES ...)
operator_id = enum(INVALID,MORE_THAN,LESS_THAN,EQUAL, ....)
operator_name = attribute operator name
sortOptions = array[struct(id, name)]
id = enum(SORT_DEFAULT,SORT_BY_DISTANCE,SORT_BY_TIME,ATTRIBUTE_CUSTOM, ... )
name = name to be displayed by application
poiCategoriesId = array of unique POI categories as registered by the POI service component.
Note: A POI category is a unique ID.
This error is generated if an application tries to send data to the POI service component but the CAM id is not registered.
The category was already added or is already a predifined one.
Note: As there is no id yet, a category is defined as unique if there was no category registered before with the same name and parent category.
UpdateCategories = Update categories in the POI service component. It could be a predifined or a customed one.
The CAM provides for each categories the list of attributes (mandatories like name or optional) it wants to update.
Depending on the local database write policy, the CAM might only be able to update customized attributes for a category and not the predefined ones so some update could be rejected.
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
poiCategories = array[unique_id, attributes, sortOptions]
List of attributes to update.
unique_id = unique category id
attributes = array[struct(name, type, array[struct(operator_id, operator_name)])
name = attribute unique name
type = enum(INVALID,STRING,INTEGER,COORDINATES ...)
operator_id = enum(INVALID,MORE_THAN,LESS_THAN,EQUAL, ....)
operator_name = attribute operator name
sortOptions = array[struct(id, name)]
id = enum(SORT_DEFAULT,BY_DISTANCE,BY_TIME,ATTRIBUTE_CUSTOM, ... )
name = name to be displayed by application
This error is generated if an application tries to send data to the POI service component but the CAM id is not registered.
At least one of the attribute of a given category was not updated due to read-only policy.
Note: The other attributes were updated.
One of the category is not available.
RemoveCategories = Remove categories from the POI service component. It could be a predifined or a customed one.
Depending on the local database write policy, the CAM might only not be able to remove some categories.
camId = Content access module unique id as known by the POI service component.
poiCategories = array[unique_id]
List of categories to remove.
unique_id = unique category id
This error is generated if an application tries to send data to the POI service component but the CAM id is not registered.
At least one of the category was not deleted due to read-only policy.
Note: The other categories were removed.
One of the category is not available.
